content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's the function `extract_julia_code` in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    lines = split(md, r"\n\r?\n")
    code_blocks = []

    pushfirst!(code_blocks, [])
    current_block = first(code_blocks)

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            push!(code_blocks, [])
        elseif endswith(line, "```")
            code_blocks[lastindex(code_blocks)] = current_block
            popat!(code_blocks, length(code_blocks))
        else
            isnothing(current_block) || push!(current_block, line)
        end
    end

    extracted_code = join(filter(!isempty), map((x) -> join(x, "\n"), code_blocks))
    extracted_code
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` accepts a string containing the markdown document and extracts all the Julia code blocks, removes code fences (triple backticks), and joins the code blocks together with a newline. It returns the extracted Julia code as a single string.
